segment.source: App capability declarations
segment.target: App capability declarations

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: Capabilities must be declared in your Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app's package manifest to access certain API or resources like pictures, music, or devices like the camera or the microphone.
segment.target: Capabilities must be declared in your Universal Windows Platform (UWP) app's package manifest to access certain API or resources like pictures, music, or devices like the camera or the microphone.

segment.source: You request access to specific resources or API by declaring capabilities in your app's package manifest.
segment.target: You request access to specific resources or API by declaring capabilities in your app's package manifest.

segment.source: You can declare general capabilities by using the Manifest Designer in Microsoft Visual Studio, or you can add them manually.
segment.target: You can declare general capabilities by using the Manifest Designer in Microsoft Visual Studio, or you can add them manually.

segment.source: For more information, see How to specify capabilities in a package manifest.
segment.target: For more information, see How to specify capabilities in a package manifest.

segment.source: It is important to know that when customers get your app from the Store, they're notified of all the capabilities that the app declares.
segment.target: It is important to know that when customers get your app from the Store, they're notified of all the capabilities that the app declares.

segment.source: Avoid declaring capabilities that your app doesn't need.
segment.target: Avoid declaring capabilities that your app doesn't need.

segment.source: Some capabilities provide apps with access to a sensitive resource.
segment.target: Some capabilities provide apps with access to a sensitive resource.

segment.source: These resources are considered sensitive because they can access the user's personal data or cost the user money.
segment.target: These resources are considered sensitive because they can access the user's personal data or cost the user money.

segment.source: Privacy settings, managed by the Settings app, let the user dynamically control access to sensitive resources.
segment.target: Privacy settings, managed by the Settings app, let the user dynamically control access to sensitive resources.

segment.source: Thus, it's important that your app doesn't assume a sensitive resource is always available.
segment.target: Thus, it's important that your app doesn't assume a sensitive resource is always available.

segment.source: For more info about accessing sensitive resources, see Guidelines for privacy-aware apps.
segment.target: For more info about accessing sensitive resources, see Guidelines for privacy-aware apps.

segment.source: Capabilities that provide apps with access to a sensitive resource are annotated by an asterisk (\*) next to the capability scenario.
segment.target: Capabilities that provide apps with access to a sensitive resource are annotated by an asterisk (\*) next to the capability scenario.

segment.source: This article reviews four categories of capabilities described below.
segment.target: This article reviews four categories of capabilities described below.

segment.source: General-use capabilities that apply to most common app scenarios.
segment.target: General-use capabilities that apply to most common app scenarios.

segment.source: Device capabilities that allow your app to access peripheral and internal devices.
segment.target: Device capabilities that allow your app to access peripheral and internal devices.

segment.source: Special-use capabilities that require a special company account for submission to the Store to use them.
segment.target: Special-use capabilities that require a special company account for submission to the Store to use them.

segment.source: For more info about company accounts, see Account types, locations, and fees.
segment.target: For more info about company accounts, see Account types, locations, and fees.

segment.source: Restricted capabilities that are only available to Microsoft and its partners.
segment.target: Restricted capabilities that are only available to Microsoft and its partners.

segment.source: General-use capabilities
segment.target: General-use capabilities

segment.source: General-use capabilities apply to the most common app scenarios.
segment.target: General-use capabilities apply to the most common app scenarios.

segment.source: Capability scenario
segment.target: Capability scenario

segment.source: Capability usage
segment.target: Capability usage

segment.source: The musicLibrary capability provides programmatic access to the user's Music, allowing the app to enumerate and access all files in the library without user interaction. This capability is typically used in jukebox apps that make use of the entire Music library.
segment.target: The musicLibrary capability provides programmatic access to the user's Music, allowing the app to enumerate and access all files in the library without user interaction. This capability is typically used in jukebox apps that make use of the entire Music library.

segment.source: The **file picker** provides a robust UI mechanism that lets users open files for use with an app. Declare the musicLibrary capability only when the scenarios for your app require programmatic access and can't be realized by using the file picker.
segment.target: The **file picker** provides a robust UI mechanism that lets users open files for use with an app. Declare the musicLibrary capability only when the scenarios for your app require programmatic access and can't be realized by using the file picker.

segment.source: The musicLibrary capability must include the uap namespace when you declare it in your app's package manifest as shown below.
segment.target: The musicLibrary capability must include the uap namespace when you declare it in your app's package manifest as shown below.

segment.source: XML
segment.target: XML

segment.source: <Capabilities> <uap:Capability Name="musicLibrary"/> </Capabilities>
segment.target: <Capabilities> <uap:Capability Name="musicLibrary"/> </Capabilities>

segment.source: The picturesLibrary capability provides programmatic access to the user's Pictures, allowing the app to enumerate and access all files in the library without user interaction. This capability is typically used in photo apps that make use of the entire Pictures library.
segment.target: The picturesLibrary capability provides programmatic access to the user's Pictures, allowing the app to enumerate and access all files in the library without user interaction. This capability is typically used in photo apps that make use of the entire Pictures library.

segment.source: The **file picker** provides a robust UI mechanism that lets users open files for use with an app. Declare the picturesLibrary capability only when the scenarios for your app require programmatic access and can't be realized them by using the file picker.
segment.target: The **file picker** provides a robust UI mechanism that lets users open files for use with an app. Declare the picturesLibrary capability only when the scenarios for your app require programmatic access and can't be realized them by using the file picker.

segment.source: The picturesLibrary capability must include the uap namespace when you declare it in your app's package manifest as shown below.
segment.target: The picturesLibrary capability must include the uap namespace when you declare it in your app's package manifest as shown below.

segment.source: XML
segment.target: XML

segment.source: <Capabilities> <uap:Capability Name="picturesLibrary"/> </Capabilities>
segment.target: <Capabilities> <uap:Capability Name="picturesLibrary"/> </Capabilities>

segment.source: The videosLibrary capability provides programmatic access to the user's Videos, allowing the app to enumerate and access all files in the library without user interaction. This capability is typically used in movie-playback apps that make use of the entire Videos library.
segment.target: The videosLibrary capability provides programmatic access to the user's Videos, allowing the app to enumerate and access all files in the library without user interaction. This capability is typically used in movie-playback apps that make use of the entire Videos library.

segment.source: The **file picker** provides a robust UI mechanism that lets users open files for use with an app. Declare the videosLibrary capability only when the scenarios for your app require programmatic access and can't be realized by using the file picker.
segment.target: The **file picker** provides a robust UI mechanism that lets users open files for use with an app. Declare the videosLibrary capability only when the scenarios for your app require programmatic access and can't be realized by using the file picker.

segment.source: The videosLibrary capability must include the uap namespace when you declare it in your app's package manifest as shown below.
segment.target: The videosLibrary capability must include the uap namespace when you declare it in your app's package manifest as shown below.

segment.source: XML
segment.target: XML

segment.source: <Capabilities> <uap:Capability Name="videosLibrary"/> </Capabilities>
segment.target: <Capabilities> <uap:Capability Name="videosLibrary"/> </Capabilities>

segment.source: The removableStorage capability provides programmatic access to files on removable storage, like USB keys and external hard drives, filtered to the file-type associations declared in the package manifest. For example, if a document-reader app declares a .doc file-type association, it can open .doc files on the removable storage device, but not other types of files. Be careful when you declare this capability, because users may include a variety of info in their removable storage devices, and will expect your app to provide a valid justification for programmatic access to the removable storage for all files of the declared type.
segment.target: The removableStorage capability provides programmatic access to files on removable storage, like USB keys and external hard drives, filtered to the file-type associations declared in the package manifest. For example, if a document-reader app declares a .doc file-type association, it can open .doc files on the removable storage device, but not other types of files. Be careful when you declare this capability, because users may include a variety of info in their removable storage devices, and will expect your app to provide a valid justification for programmatic access to the removable storage for all files of the declared type.

segment.source: Users will expect your app to handle any file associations that you declare. So don't declare file associations that your app cannot handle responsibly. The **file picker** provides a robust UI mechanism that lets users open files for use with an app.
segment.target: Users will expect your app to handle any file associations that you declare. So don't declare file associations that your app cannot handle responsibly. The **file picker** provides a robust UI mechanism that lets users open files for use with an app.

segment.source: Declare the removableStorage capability only when the scenarios for your app require programmatic access and can't be realized by using the **file picker**.
segment.target: Declare the removableStorage capability only when the scenarios for your app require programmatic access and can't be realized by using the **file picker**.

segment.source: The removableStorage capability must include the uap namespace when you declare it in your app's package manifest as shown below.
segment.target: The removableStorage capability must include the uap namespace when you declare it in your app's package manifest as shown below.

segment.source: XML
segment.target: XML

segment.source: <Capabilities> <uap:Capability Name="removableStorage"/> </Capabilities>
segment.target: <Capabilities> <uap:Capability Name="removableStorage"/> </Capabilities>

segment.source: There are two capabilities that provide different levels of access to the Internet and public networks.
segment.target: There are two capabilities that provide different levels of access to the Internet and public networks.

segment.source: The internetClient capability indicates that apps can receive incoming data from the Internet. Cannot act as a server. No local network access.
segment.target: The internetClient capability indicates that apps can receive incoming data from the Internet. Cannot act as a server. No local network access.

segment.source: The internetClientServer capability indicates that apps can receive incoming data from the Internet. Can act as a server. No local network access.
segment.target: The internetClientServer capability indicates that apps can receive incoming data from the Internet. Can act as a server. No local network access.

segment.source: Most apps that have a web service component will use internetClient. Apps that enable peer-to-peer (P2P) scenarios where the app needs to listen for incoming network connections should use internetClientServer. The internetClientServer capability includes the access that the internetClient capability provides, so you don't need to specify internetClient when you specify internetClientServer.
segment.target: Most apps that have a web service component will use internetClient. Apps that enable peer-to-peer (P2P) scenarios where the app needs to listen for incoming network connections should use internetClientServer. The internetClientServer capability includes the access that the internetClient capability provides, so you don't need to specify internetClient when you specify internetClientServer.

segment.source: The privateNetworkClientServer capability provides inbound and outbound access to home and work networks through the firewall. This capability is typically used for games that communicate across the local area network (LAN), and for apps that share data across a variety of local devices. If your app specifies musicLibrary, picturesLibrary, or videosLibrary, you don't need to use this capability to access the corresponding library in a Home Group. On Windows, this capability does not provide access to the Internet.
segment.target: The privateNetworkClientServer capability provides inbound and outbound access to home and work networks through the firewall. This capability is typically used for games that communicate across the local area network (LAN), and for apps that share data across a variety of local devices. If your app specifies musicLibrary, picturesLibrary, or videosLibrary, you don't need to use this capability to access the corresponding library in a Home Group. On Windows, this capability does not provide access to the Internet.

segment.source: The appointments capability provides access to the user’s appointment store. This capability allows read access to appointments obtained from the synced network accounts and to other apps that write to the appointment store. With this capability, your app can create new calendars and write appointments to calendars that it creates.
segment.target: The appointments capability provides access to the user’s appointment store. This capability allows read access to appointments obtained from the synced network accounts and to other apps that write to the appointment store. With this capability, your app can create new calendars and write appointments to calendars that it creates.

segment.source: The appointments capability must include the uap namespace when you declare it in your app's package manifest as shown below.
segment.target: The appointments capability must include the uap namespace when you declare it in your app's package manifest as shown below.

segment.source: XML
segment.target: XML

segment.source: <Capabilities> <uap:Capability Name="appointments"/> </Capabilities>
segment.target: <Capabilities> <uap:Capability Name="appointments"/> </Capabilities>

segment.source: The contacts capability provides access to the aggregated view of the contacts from various contacts stores. This capability gives the app limited access (network permitting rules apply) to contacts that were synced from various networks and the local contact store.
segment.target: The contacts capability provides access to the aggregated view of the contacts from various contacts stores. This capability gives the app limited access (network permitting rules apply) to contacts that were synced from various networks and the local contact store.

segment.source: The contacts capability must include the uap namespace when you declare it in your app's package manifest as shown below.
segment.target: The contacts capability must include the uap namespace when you declare it in your app's package manifest as shown below.

segment.source: XML
segment.target: XML

segment.source: <Capabilities> <uap:Capability Name="contacts"/> </Capabilities>
segment.target: <Capabilities> <uap:Capability Name="contacts"/> </Capabilities>

segment.source: The codeGeneration capability allows apps to access the following functions which provide JIT capabilities to apps.
segment.target: The codeGeneration capability allows apps to access the following functions which provide JIT capabilities to apps.

segment.source: The allJoyn capability allows AllJoyn-enabled apps and devices on a network to discover and interact with each other.
segment.target: The allJoyn capability allows AllJoyn-enabled apps and devices on a network to discover and interact with each other.

segment.source: All apps that access APIs in the **Windows.Devices.AllJoyn** namespace must use this capability.
segment.target: All apps that access APIs in the **Windows.Devices.AllJoyn** namespace must use this capability.

segment.source: The phoneCall capability allows apps to access all of the phone lines on the device and perform the following functions.
segment.target: The phoneCall capability allows apps to access all of the phone lines on the device and perform the following functions.

segment.source: Place a call on the phone line and show the system dialer without prompting the user.
segment.target: Place a call on the phone line and show the system dialer without prompting the user.

segment.source: Access line-related metadata.
segment.target: Access line-related metadata.

segment.source: Access line-related triggers.
segment.target: Access line-related triggers.

segment.source: Allows the user-selected spam filter app to set and check block list and call origin information.
segment.target: Allows the user-selected spam filter app to set and check block list and call origin information.

segment.source: The phoneCall capability must include the uap namespace when you declare it in your app's package manifest as shown below.
segment.target: The phoneCall capability must include the uap namespace when you declare it in your app's package manifest as shown below.

segment.source: XML
segment.target: XML

segment.source: <Capabilities> <uap:Capability Name="phoneCall"/> </Capabilities>
segment.target: <Capabilities> <uap:Capability Name="phoneCall"/> </Capabilities>

segment.source: The phoneCallHistoryPublic capability allows apps to read cellular and some VOIP call history information on the device. This capability also allows the app to write VOIP call history entries. This capability is required to access all members of the **PhoneCallHistoryStore** class.
segment.target: The phoneCallHistoryPublic capability allows apps to read cellular and some VOIP call history information on the device. This capability also allows the app to write VOIP call history entries. This capability is required to access all members of the **PhoneCallHistoryStore** class.

segment.source: The recordedCallsFolder device capability allows apps to access the recorded calls folder.
segment.target: The recordedCallsFolder device capability allows apps to access the recorded calls folder.

segment.source: The recordedCallsFolder capability must include the mobile namespace when you declare it in your app's package manifest as shown below.
segment.target: The recordedCallsFolder capability must include the mobile namespace when you declare it in your app's package manifest as shown below.

segment.source: XML
segment.target: XML

segment.source: <Capabilities> <mobile:Capability Name="recordedCallsFolder"/> </Capabilities>
segment.target: <Capabilities> <mobile:Capability Name="recordedCallsFolder"/> </Capabilities>

segment.source: The userAccountInformation capability gives apps the ability to access the user's name and picture.
segment.target: The userAccountInformation capability gives apps the ability to access the user's name and picture.

segment.source: This capability is required to access some APIs in the Windows.System.User namespace.
segment.target: This capability is required to access some APIs in the Windows.System.User namespace.

segment.source: The userAccountInformation capability must include the uap namespace when you declare it in your app's package manifest as shown below.
segment.target: The userAccountInformation capability must include the uap namespace when you declare it in your app's package manifest as shown below.

segment.source: XML
segment.target: XML

segment.source: <Capabilities> <uap:Capability Name="userAccountInformation"/> </Capabilities>
segment.target: <Capabilities> <uap:Capability Name="userAccountInformation"/> </Capabilities>

segment.source: The voipCall capability allows apps to access the VOIP calling APIs in the **Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls** namespace.
segment.target: The voipCall capability allows apps to access the VOIP calling APIs in the **Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls** namespace.

segment.source: The voipCall capability must include the uap namespace when you declare it in your app's package manifest as shown below.
segment.target: The voipCall capability must include the uap namespace when you declare it in your app's package manifest as shown below.

segment.source: XML
segment.target: XML

segment.source: <Capabilities> <uap:Capability Name="voipCall"/> </Capabilities>
segment.target: <Capabilities> <uap:Capability Name="voipCall"/> </Capabilities>

segment.source: The objects3D capability allows apps to have programmatic access to the 3D object files. This capability is typically used in 3D apps and games that need access to the entire 3D objects library.
segment.target: The objects3D capability allows apps to have programmatic access to the 3D object files. This capability is typically used in 3D apps and games that need access to the entire 3D objects library.

segment.source: This capability is required to access the folder that contains the 3D objects using APIs in the **Windows.Storage** namespace.
segment.target: This capability is required to access the folder that contains the 3D objects using APIs in the **Windows.Storage** namespace.

segment.source: The objects3D capability must include the uap namespace when you declare it in your app's package manifest as shown below.
segment.target: The objects3D capability must include the uap namespace when you declare it in your app's package manifest as shown below.

segment.source: XML
segment.target: XML

segment.source: <Capabilities> <uap:Capability Name="objects3d"/> </Capabilities>
segment.target: <Capabilities> <uap:Capability Name="objects3d"/> </Capabilities>

segment.source: The blockedChatMessages capability allows apps to read SMS and MMS messages that have been blocked by the Spam Filter app.
segment.target: The blockedChatMessages capability allows apps to read SMS and MMS messages that have been blocked by the Spam Filter app.

segment.source: This capability is required to access the blocked messages using APIs in the **Windows.ApplicationModel.Chat** namespace.
segment.target: This capability is required to access the blocked messages using APIs in the **Windows.ApplicationModel.Chat** namespace.

segment.source: The blockedChatMessages capability must include the uap namespace when you declare it in your app's package manifest as shown below.
segment.target: The blockedChatMessages capability must include the uap namespace when you declare it in your app's package manifest as shown below.

segment.source: XML
segment.target: XML

segment.source: <Capabilities> <uap:Capability Name="blockedChatMessages"/> </Capabilities>
segment.target: <Capabilities> <uap:Capability Name="blockedChatMessages"/> </Capabilities>

segment.source: The chat capability allows apps to read and delete Text Messages. This capability also allows apps to store chat messages in the system data store.
segment.target: The chat capability allows apps to read and delete Text Messages. This capability also allows apps to store chat messages in the system data store.

segment.source: This capability is required to use some APIs in the **Windows.ApplicationModel.Chat** namespace.
segment.target: This capability is required to use some APIs in the **Windows.ApplicationModel.Chat** namespace.

segment.source: The chat capability must include the uap namespace when you declare it in your app's package manifest as shown below.
segment.target: The chat capability must include the uap namespace when you declare it in your app's package manifest as shown below.

segment.source: XML
segment.target: XML

segment.source: <Capabilities> <uap:Capability Name="chat"/> </Capabilities>
segment.target: <Capabilities> <uap:Capability Name="chat"/> </Capabilities>

segment.source: The lowLevelDevices capability allows apps that run on IoT devices to access low-level bus hardware such as GPIO, I2C, SPI, ADC, and PWM.
segment.target: The lowLevelDevices capability allows apps that run on IoT devices to access low-level bus hardware such as GPIO, I2C, SPI, ADC, and PWM.

segment.source: This capability is required to access some APIs in the **Windows.Devices.Spi** namespaces.
segment.target: This capability is required to access some APIs in the **Windows.Devices.Spi** namespaces.

segment.source: The lowLevelDevices capability must include the iot namespace when you declare it in your app's package manifest as shown below.
segment.target: The lowLevelDevices capability must include the iot namespace when you declare it in your app's package manifest as shown below.

segment.source: XML
segment.target: XML

segment.source: <Capabilities> <iot:Capability Name="lowLevelDevices"/> </Capabilities>
segment.target: <Capabilities> <iot:Capability Name="lowLevelDevices"/> </Capabilities>

segment.source: The systemManagement capability allows apps to have basic system administration privileges such as shutting down or rebooting, locale, and timezone.
segment.target: The systemManagement capability allows apps to have basic system administration privileges such as shutting down or rebooting, locale, and timezone.

segment.source: This capability is required to access some of the APIs in the **Windows.System** namespace.
segment.target: This capability is required to access some of the APIs in the **Windows.System** namespace.

segment.source: The systemManagement capability must include the iot namespace when you declare it in your app's package manifest as shown below.
segment.target: The systemManagement capability must include the iot namespace when you declare it in your app's package manifest as shown below.

segment.source: XML
segment.target: XML

segment.source: <Capabilities> <iot:Capability Name="systemManagement"/> </Capabilities>
segment.target: <Capabilities> <iot:Capability Name="systemManagement"/> </Capabilities>

segment.source: Device capabilities
segment.target: Device capabilities

segment.source: Device capabilities allow your app to access peripheral and internal devices.
segment.target: Device capabilities allow your app to access peripheral and internal devices.

segment.source: Device capabilities are specified by using the DeviceCapability element in your app package manifest.
segment.target: Device capabilities are specified by using the DeviceCapability element in your app package manifest.

segment.source: This element may require additional child elements and some device capabilities need to be added to the package manifest manually.
segment.target: This element may require additional child elements and some device capabilities need to be added to the package manifest manually.

segment.source: For more info, see How to specify device capabilities in a package manifest and **DeviceCapability Schema reference**.
segment.target: For more info, see How to specify device capabilities in a package manifest and **DeviceCapability Schema reference**.

segment.source: Capability scenario
segment.target: Capability scenario

segment.source: Capability usage
segment.target: Capability usage

segment.source: The location capability provides access to location functionality that is retrieved from dedicated hardware like a GPS sensor in the PC or is derived from available network info.
segment.target: The location capability provides access to location functionality that is retrieved from dedicated hardware like a GPS sensor in the PC or is derived from available network info.

segment.source: Apps must handle the case in which the user has disabled location services from the Settings charm.
segment.target: Apps must handle the case in which the user has disabled location services from the Settings charm.

segment.source: The microphone capability provides access to the microphone’s audio feed, which allows the app to record audio from connected microphones.
segment.target: The microphone capability provides access to the microphone’s audio feed, which allows the app to record audio from connected microphones.

segment.source: Apps must handle the case in which the user has disabled the microphone from the Settings charm.
segment.target: Apps must handle the case in which the user has disabled the microphone from the Settings charm.

segment.source: The proximity capability enables multiple devices in close proximity to communicate with one another.
segment.target: The proximity capability enables multiple devices in close proximity to communicate with one another.

segment.source: This capability is typically used in casual multi-player games and in apps that exchange information.
segment.target: This capability is typically used in casual multi-player games and in apps that exchange information.

segment.source: Devices attempt to use the communication technology that provides the best possible connection, including Bluetooth, Wi-Fi, and the Internet.
segment.target: Devices attempt to use the communication technology that provides the best possible connection, including Bluetooth, Wi-Fi, and the Internet.

segment.source: This capability is used only to initiate communication between the devices.
segment.target: This capability is used only to initiate communication between the devices.

segment.source: The webcam capability provides access to the video feed of a built-in camera or external webcam, which allows the app to capture photos and videos.
segment.target: The webcam capability provides access to the video feed of a built-in camera or external webcam, which allows the app to capture photos and videos.

segment.source: On Windows, apps must handle the case in which the user has disabled the camera from the Settings charm.
segment.target: On Windows, apps must handle the case in which the user has disabled the camera from the Settings charm.

segment.source: The webcam capability only grants access to the video stream.
segment.target: The webcam capability only grants access to the video stream.

segment.source: In order to grant access to the audio stream as well, the microphone capability must be added.
segment.target: In order to grant access to the audio stream as well, the microphone capability must be added.

segment.source: The usb device capability enables access to APIs in the Updating the app manifest package for a USB device.
segment.target: The usb device capability enables access to APIs in the Updating the app manifest package for a USB device.

segment.source: The humaninterfacedevice device capability enables access to APIs in the How to specify device capabilities for HID.
segment.target: The humaninterfacedevice device capability enables access to APIs in the How to specify device capabilities for HID.

segment.source: The pointOfService device capability enables access to APIs in the **Windows.Devices.PointOfService** namespace.
segment.target: The pointOfService device capability enables access to APIs in the **Windows.Devices.PointOfService** namespace.

segment.source: This namespace lets your app access Point of Service (POS) barcode scanners and magnetic stripe readers.
segment.target: This namespace lets your app access Point of Service (POS) barcode scanners and magnetic stripe readers.

segment.source: The namespace provides a vendor-neutral interface for accessing POS devices from various manufacturers from a Windows Store app.
segment.target: The namespace provides a vendor-neutral interface for accessing POS devices from various manufacturers from a Windows Store app.

segment.source: The bluetooth device capability allows apps to communicate with already paired bluetooth devices over both Generic Attribute (GATT) or Classic Basic Rate (RFCOMM) protocol.
segment.target: The bluetooth device capability allows apps to communicate with already paired bluetooth devices over both Generic Attribute (GATT) or Classic Basic Rate (RFCOMM) protocol.

segment.source: This capability is required to use some APIs in the **Windows.Devices.Bluetooth** namespace.
segment.target: This capability is required to use some APIs in the **Windows.Devices.Bluetooth** namespace.

segment.source: The wiFiControl device capability allows apps to scan and connect to Wi-Fi networks.
segment.target: The wiFiControl device capability allows apps to scan and connect to Wi-Fi networks.

segment.source: This capability is required to use some APIs in the **Windows.Devices.WiFi** namespace.
segment.target: This capability is required to use some APIs in the **Windows.Devices.WiFi** namespace.

segment.source: The radios device capability allows apps to toggle the Wi-Fi and Bluetooth radios.
segment.target: The radios device capability allows apps to toggle the Wi-Fi and Bluetooth radios.

segment.source: This capability is required to use the APIs in the **Windows.Devices.Radios** namespace.
segment.target: This capability is required to use the APIs in the **Windows.Devices.Radios** namespace.

segment.source: The optical device capability allows apps to access functions on optical disk drives such as CD, DVD, and Blu-ray.
segment.target: The optical device capability allows apps to access functions on optical disk drives such as CD, DVD, and Blu-ray.

segment.source: This capability is required to use some APIs in the **Windows.Devices.Custom** namespace.
segment.target: This capability is required to use some APIs in the **Windows.Devices.Custom** namespace.

segment.source: The activity device capability allows apps to detect the current motion of the device.
segment.target: The activity device capability allows apps to detect the current motion of the device.

segment.source: This capability is required to use some APIs in the **Windows.Devices.Sensors** namespace.
segment.target: This capability is required to use some APIs in the **Windows.Devices.Sensors** namespace.

segment.source: Special and restricted capabilities
segment.target: Special and restricted capabilities

segment.source: Special and restricted capabilities are intended for very specific scenarios.
segment.target: Special and restricted capabilities are intended for very specific scenarios.

segment.source: The use of these capabilities is highly restricted and subject to additional Store onboarding policy and review.
segment.target: The use of these capabilities is highly restricted and subject to additional Store onboarding policy and review.

segment.source: There are cases where such capabilities are necessary and appropriate, such as banking with two-factor authentication, where users provide a smart card with a digital certificate that confirms their identity.
segment.target: There are cases where such capabilities are necessary and appropriate, such as banking with two-factor authentication, where users provide a smart card with a digital certificate that confirms their identity.

segment.source: Other apps may be designed primarily for enterprise customers and may need access to corporate resources that cannot be accessed without the user’s domain credentials.
segment.target: Other apps may be designed primarily for enterprise customers and may need access to corporate resources that cannot be accessed without the user’s domain credentials.

segment.source: Apps that apply the special-use capabilities require a company account to submit them to the Store.
segment.target: Apps that apply the special-use capabilities require a company account to submit them to the Store.

segment.source: In contrast, restricted capabilities do not require a special company account for the Store, they are not available for developers to use.
segment.target: In contrast, restricted capabilities do not require a special company account for the Store, they are not available for developers to use.

segment.source: Restricted capabilities are available only to apps that are developed by Microsoft and its partners.
segment.target: Restricted capabilities are available only to apps that are developed by Microsoft and its partners.

segment.source: For more information about company accounts, see Account types, locations, and fees.
segment.target: For more information about company accounts, see Account types, locations, and fees.

segment.source: All restricted capabilities must include the rescap namespace when you declare them in your app's package manifest differently than other capabilities.
segment.target: All restricted capabilities must include the rescap namespace when you declare them in your app's package manifest differently than other capabilities.

segment.source: The following example shows you how to declare the appCaptureSettings capability.
segment.target: The following example shows you how to declare the appCaptureSettings capability.

segment.source: You must also add the xmlns:rescap namespace declaration in the top of the Package.appxmanifest file as shown below.
segment.target: You must also add the xmlns:rescap namespace declaration in the top of the Package.appxmanifest file as shown below.

segment.source: Capability scenario
segment.target: Capability scenario

segment.source: Capability usage
segment.target: Capability usage

segment.source: Windows domain credentials enable a user to log into remote resources using their credentials, and act as if a user provided their user name and password. The enterpriseAuthentication special capability is typically used in line-of-business apps that connect to servers within an enterprise.
segment.target: Windows domain credentials enable a user to log into remote resources using their credentials, and act as if a user provided their user name and password. The enterpriseAuthentication special capability is typically used in line-of-business apps that connect to servers within an enterprise.

segment.source: You don't need this capability for generic communication across the Internet.
segment.target: You don't need this capability for generic communication across the Internet.

segment.source: The enterpriseAuthentication special capability is intended to support common line-of-business apps. Don't declare it in apps that don't need to access corporate resources. The **file picker** provides a robust UI mechanism that enables users to open files on a network share for use with an app. Declare the enterpriseAuthentication special capability only when the scenarios for your app require programmatic access, and you cannot realize them by using the file picker.
segment.target: The enterpriseAuthentication special capability is intended to support common line-of-business apps. Don't declare it in apps that don't need to access corporate resources. The **file picker** provides a robust UI mechanism that enables users to open files on a network share for use with an app. Declare the enterpriseAuthentication special capability only when the scenarios for your app require programmatic access, and you cannot realize them by using the file picker.

segment.source: The enterpriseAuthentication capability must include the uap namespace when you declare it in your app's package manifest as shown below.
segment.target: The enterpriseAuthentication capability must include the uap namespace when you declare it in your app's package manifest as shown below.

segment.source: XML
segment.target: XML

segment.source: <Capabilities> <uap:Capability Name="enterpriseAuthentication"/> </Capabilities>
segment.target: <Capabilities> <uap:Capability Name="enterpriseAuthentication"/> </Capabilities>

segment.source: The enterpriseDataPolicy capability allows apps to define and use enterprise-specific policies for the device. This capability is required to use all members of the following classes.
segment.target: The enterpriseDataPolicy capability allows apps to define and use enterprise-specific policies for the device. This capability is required to use all members of the following classes.

segment.source: The sharedUserCertificates special capability enables an app to add and access software and hardware-based certificates in the Shared User store, such as certificates stored on a smart card. This capability is typically used for financial or enterprise apps that require a smart card for authentication.
segment.target: The sharedUserCertificates special capability enables an app to add and access software and hardware-based certificates in the Shared User store, such as certificates stored on a smart card. This capability is typically used for financial or enterprise apps that require a smart card for authentication.

segment.source: The sharedUserCertificates capability must include the uap namespace when you declare it in your app's package manifest as shown below.
segment.target: The sharedUserCertificates capability must include the uap namespace when you declare it in your app's package manifest as shown below.

segment.source: XML
segment.target: XML

segment.source: <Capabilities> <uap:Capability Name="sharedUserCertificates"/> </Capabilities>
segment.target: <Capabilities> <uap:Capability Name="sharedUserCertificates"/> </Capabilities>

segment.source: The documentsLibrary special capability provides programmatic access to the user's Documents, filtered to the file type associations declared in the package manifest, to support offline access to OneDrive. For example, if a DOC reader app declared a .doc file type association, it can open .doc files in Documents, but not other types of files.
segment.target: The documentsLibrary special capability provides programmatic access to the user's Documents, filtered to the file type associations declared in the package manifest, to support offline access to OneDrive. For example, if a DOC reader app declared a .doc file type association, it can open .doc files in Documents, but not other types of files.

segment.source: Apps that declare the documentsLibrary special capability can't access Documents on Home Group computers. The file picker provides a robust UI mechanism that enables users to open files for use with an app. Declare the documentsLibrary special capability only when you cannot use the file picker.
segment.target: Apps that declare the documentsLibrary special capability can't access Documents on Home Group computers. The file picker provides a robust UI mechanism that enables users to open files for use with an app. Declare the documentsLibrary special capability only when you cannot use the file picker.

segment.source: To use the documentsLibrary special capability, an app must:
segment.target: To use the documentsLibrary special capability, an app must:

segment.source: Facilitate cross-platform offline access to specific OneDrive content using valid OneDrive URLs or Resource IDs
segment.target: Facilitate cross-platform offline access to specific OneDrive content using valid OneDrive URLs or Resource IDs

segment.source: Save open files to the user’s OneDrive automatically while offline
segment.target: Save open files to the user’s OneDrive automatically while offline

segment.source: Apps that use the documentsLibrary special capability for these two purposes may also optionally use the capability to open embedded content within another document. Only the above uses of the documentsLibrary special capability are accepted.
segment.target: Apps that use the documentsLibrary special capability for these two purposes may also optionally use the capability to open embedded content within another document. Only the above uses of the documentsLibrary special capability are accepted.

segment.source: Your app can't access the Documents library in the phone's internal storage. If another app creates a Documents folder on the optional SD card, however, your app can see that folder.
segment.target: Your app can't access the Documents library in the phone's internal storage. If another app creates a Documents folder on the optional SD card, however, your app can see that folder.

segment.source: The documentsLibrary capability must include the uap namespace when you declare it in your app's package manifest as shown below.
segment.target: The documentsLibrary capability must include the uap namespace when you declare it in your app's package manifest as shown below.

segment.source: XML
segment.target: XML

segment.source: <Capabilities> <uap:Capability Name="documentsLibrary"/> </Capabilities>
segment.target: <Capabilities> <uap:Capability Name="documentsLibrary"/> </Capabilities>

segment.source: The appCaptureSettings restricted capability allows apps to control the user settings for the Game DVR.
segment.target: The appCaptureSettings restricted capability allows apps to control the user settings for the Game DVR.

segment.source: This capability is required to use some APIs in the **Windows.Media.Capture** namespace.
segment.target: This capability is required to use some APIs in the **Windows.Media.Capture** namespace.

segment.source: The cellularDeviceControl restricted capability allows apps to have control over the cellular device.
segment.target: The cellularDeviceControl restricted capability allows apps to have control over the cellular device.

segment.source: The cellularDeviceIdentity capability allows apps to access cellular identification data.
segment.target: The cellularDeviceIdentity capability allows apps to access cellular identification data.

segment.source: The cellularMessaging capability allows apps to make use of SMS and RCS.
segment.target: The cellularMessaging capability allows apps to make use of SMS and RCS.

segment.source: These capabilities are required to use some APIs in the **Windows.Devices.Sms** namespaces.
segment.target: These capabilities are required to use some APIs in the **Windows.Devices.Sms** namespaces.

segment.source: Starting in Windows 10, apps calling **AppIDList**.
segment.target: Starting in Windows 10, apps calling **AppIDList**.

segment.source: The deviceUnlock restricted capability allows apps to unlock a device for developer and enterprise sideloading scenarios.
segment.target: The deviceUnlock restricted capability allows apps to unlock a device for developer and enterprise sideloading scenarios.

segment.source: The dualSimTiles restricted capability allows apps to create an additional app list entry on devices that have multiple SIMs.
segment.target: The dualSimTiles restricted capability allows apps to create an additional app list entry on devices that have multiple SIMs.

segment.source: This capability is required to use some APIs in the **Windows.UI.StartScreen** namespace.
segment.target: This capability is required to use some APIs in the **Windows.UI.StartScreen** namespace.

segment.source: The enterpriseDeviceLockdown restricted capability allows apps to use the device lock down API and access the enterprise shared storage folders.
segment.target: The enterpriseDeviceLockdown restricted capability allows apps to use the device lock down API and access the enterprise shared storage folders.

segment.source: The inputInjection restricted capability allows apps to inject various forms of input such as HID, touch, pen, keyboard or mouse into the system programmatically. This capability is typically used for collaboration apps that can take control of the system.
segment.target: The inputInjection restricted capability allows apps to inject various forms of input such as HID, touch, pen, keyboard or mouse into the system programmatically. This capability is typically used for collaboration apps that can take control of the system.

segment.source: Note For a PC, input injection from an app that has this capability will only be received by processes in the same App Container.
segment.target: Note For a PC, input injection from an app that has this capability will only be received by processes in the same App Container.

segment.source: The inputObservation restricted capability allows apps to observe various forms of raw input such as HID, touch, pen, keyboard, or mouse being received by the system regardless of its final destination.
segment.target: The inputObservation restricted capability allows apps to observe various forms of raw input such as HID, touch, pen, keyboard, or mouse being received by the system regardless of its final destination.

segment.source: The inputSuppression restricted capability allows apps to suppress various forms of raw input such as HID, touch, pen, keyboard, or mouse from being received by the system.
segment.target: The inputSuppression restricted capability allows apps to suppress various forms of raw input such as HID, touch, pen, keyboard, or mouse from being received by the system.

segment.source: The networkingVpnProvider restricted capability allows apps to have full access to VPN features, including the ability to manage connections and provide VPN Plugin functionality.
segment.target: The networkingVpnProvider restricted capability allows apps to have full access to VPN features, including the ability to manage connections and provide VPN Plugin functionality.

segment.source: This capability is required to use some APIs in the **Windows.Networking.Vpn** namespace.
segment.target: This capability is required to use some APIs in the **Windows.Networking.Vpn** namespace.

segment.source: The packageManagement restricted capability allows apps to manage other apps directly.
segment.target: The packageManagement restricted capability allows apps to manage other apps directly.

segment.source: The packageQuery device capability allows apps to gather information about other apps.
segment.target: The packageQuery device capability allows apps to gather information about other apps.

segment.source: These capabilities are required to access some methods and properties in the **PackageManager** class.
segment.target: These capabilities are required to access some methods and properties in the **PackageManager** class.

segment.source: The screenDuplication restricted capability allows apps to project the screen on another device.
segment.target: The screenDuplication restricted capability allows apps to project the screen on another device.

segment.source: This capability is required to use APIs in the DirectX namespace.
segment.target: This capability is required to use APIs in the DirectX namespace.

segment.source: The userPrincipalName restricted capability allows apps to modify and access the thumbnail cache from photos.
segment.target: The userPrincipalName restricted capability allows apps to modify and access the thumbnail cache from photos.

segment.source: This capability is required to call the **GetUserNameEx** function.
segment.target: This capability is required to call the **GetUserNameEx** function.

segment.source: The walletSystem restricted capability allows apps to have full access to the stored wallet cards.
segment.target: The walletSystem restricted capability allows apps to have full access to the stored wallet cards.

segment.source: This capability is required to use APIs in the **Windows.ApplicationModel.Wallet.System** namespace.
segment.target: This capability is required to use APIs in the **Windows.ApplicationModel.Wallet.System** namespace.

segment.source: The locationHistory restricted capability allows apps to access the location history of the device.
segment.target: The locationHistory restricted capability allows apps to access the location history of the device.

segment.source: This capability is required to use APIs in the **Windows.Devices.Geolocation** namespace.
segment.target: This capability is required to use APIs in the **Windows.Devices.Geolocation** namespace.

segment.source: The confirmAppClose restricted capability allows apps to close themselves, their own windows, and delay the closing of their app.
segment.target: The confirmAppClose restricted capability allows apps to close themselves, their own windows, and delay the closing of their app.

segment.source: This capability is required to use APIs in the **Windows.UI.ViewManagement** namespace.
segment.target: This capability is required to use APIs in the **Windows.UI.ViewManagement** namespace.

segment.source: The phoneCallHistory restricted capability allows apps to read the call history and to delete entries in the history.
segment.target: The phoneCallHistory restricted capability allows apps to read the call history and to delete entries in the history.

segment.source: This capability is required to use APIs in the **Windows.ApplicationModel.Chat** namespace.
segment.target: This capability is required to use APIs in the **Windows.ApplicationModel.Chat** namespace.

segment.source: The appointmentsSystem restricted capability allows apps to read and modify all appointments on the user's calendar.
segment.target: The appointmentsSystem restricted capability allows apps to read and modify all appointments on the user's calendar.

segment.source: This capability is required to use APIs in the **Windows.ApplicationModel.Appointment** namespace.
segment.target: This capability is required to use APIs in the **Windows.ApplicationModel.Appointment** namespace.

segment.source: The chatSystem restricted capability allows apps to read and write all SMS and MMS messages.
segment.target: The chatSystem restricted capability allows apps to read and write all SMS and MMS messages.

segment.source: This capability is required to use APIs in the **Windows.ApplicationModel.Chat** namespace.
segment.target: This capability is required to use APIs in the **Windows.ApplicationModel.Chat** namespace.

segment.source: The contactsSystem restricted capability allows apps to read contact information that has been designated as restricted or sensitive and modify existing contact information.
segment.target: The contactsSystem restricted capability allows apps to read contact information that has been designated as restricted or sensitive and modify existing contact information.

segment.source: This capability is required to use APIs in the **Windows.ApplicationModel.Chat** namespace.
segment.target: This capability is required to use APIs in the **Windows.ApplicationModel.Chat** namespace.

segment.source: The email restricted capability allows apps to read, triage, and send user emails.
segment.target: The email restricted capability allows apps to read, triage, and send user emails.

segment.source: This capability is required to use APIs in the **Windows.ApplicationModel.Email** namespace.
segment.target: This capability is required to use APIs in the **Windows.ApplicationModel.Email** namespace.

segment.source: The emailSystem restricted capability allows apps to read, triage, and send user restricted or sensitive emails.
segment.target: The emailSystem restricted capability allows apps to read, triage, and send user restricted or sensitive emails.

segment.source: This capability is required to use APIs in the **Windows.ApplicationModel.Email** namespace.
segment.target: This capability is required to use APIs in the **Windows.ApplicationModel.Email** namespace.

segment.source: The phoneCallHistorySystem restricted capability allows apps to fully modify the call history by changing existing entries and writing new ones.
segment.target: The phoneCallHistorySystem restricted capability allows apps to fully modify the call history by changing existing entries and writing new ones.

segment.source: This capability is required to use APIs in the **Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls** namespace.
segment.target: This capability is required to use APIs in the **Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls** namespace.

segment.source: The smsSend restricted capability allows apps to send SMS and MMS messages.
segment.target: The smsSend restricted capability allows apps to send SMS and MMS messages.

segment.source: This capability is required to use APIs in the **Windows.ApplicationModel.Chat** namespace.
segment.target: This capability is required to use APIs in the **Windows.ApplicationModel.Chat** namespace.

source.pc: System Level Access to All User Data

target.pc: System Level Access to All User Data

segment.source: The userDataSystem restricted capability allows apps to access the user data system datastore.
segment.target: The userDataSystem restricted capability allows apps to access the user data system datastore.

segment.source: The previewStore restricted capability allows apps to retrieve and purchase SKUs of in-app products.
segment.target: The previewStore restricted capability allows apps to retrieve and purchase SKUs of in-app products.

segment.source: This capability is required to use certain APIs in the **Windows.ApplicationModel.Store.Preview** namespace.
segment.target: This capability is required to use certain APIs in the **Windows.ApplicationModel.Store.Preview** namespace.

segment.source: The firstSignInSettings restricted capability allows apps to access user settings that were set when the user first signed in to their device.
segment.target: The firstSignInSettings restricted capability allows apps to access user settings that were set when the user first signed in to their device.

segment.source: The teamEditionExperience restricted capability allows apps to access internal APIs that control many experiential aspects of a Windows Team session. A Windows Team session is likely to be running on a team device such as a Microsoft Surface Hub.
segment.target: The teamEditionExperience restricted capability allows apps to access internal APIs that control many experiential aspects of a Windows Team session. A Windows Team session is likely to be running on a team device such as a Microsoft Surface Hub.

segment.source: The remotePassportAuthentication restricted capability allows apps to access credentials that can be used to unlock a remote PC.
segment.target: The remotePassportAuthentication restricted capability allows apps to access credentials that can be used to unlock a remote PC.

segment.source: The previewUiComposition restricted capability allows apps to preview the **Windows.UI.Composition** namespace for their user interface so they can provide feedback on the API before it is completed. Please contact wincomposition@microsoft.com for more information.
segment.target: The previewUiComposition restricted capability allows apps to preview the **Windows.UI.Composition** namespace for their user interface so they can provide feedback on the API before it is completed. Please contact wincomposition@microsoft.com for more information.

segment.source: The secureAssessment restricted capability allows apps to lockdown Windows into a single app mode for secure assessments.
segment.target: The secureAssessment restricted capability allows apps to lockdown Windows into a single app mode for secure assessments.

segment.source: The networkConnectionManagerProvisioning restricted capability allows apps to define the policies that connect the device with WWAN and WLAN interfaces. Apps that use this capability are created by Mobile Operators to govern the devices that connect to their mobile network.
segment.target: The networkConnectionManagerProvisioning restricted capability allows apps to define the policies that connect the device with WWAN and WLAN interfaces. Apps that use this capability are created by Mobile Operators to govern the devices that connect to their mobile network.

segment.source: The networkDataPlanProvisioning restricted capability allows apps to gather information about data plans on the device and read network usage. Apps that use this capability are created by Mobile Operators to integrate their customers’ actual data usage into the OS Data usage setting.
segment.target: The networkDataPlanProvisioning restricted capability allows apps to gather information about data plans on the device and read network usage. Apps that use this capability are created by Mobile Operators to integrate their customers’ actual data usage into the OS Data usage setting.

segment.source: The slapiQueryLicenseValue restricted capability allows apps to query software licensing policies.
segment.target: The slapiQueryLicenseValue restricted capability allows apps to query software licensing policies.

segment.source: The extendedExecutionBackgroundAudio restricted capability allows apps to play audio when the app is not in the foreground.
segment.target: The extendedExecutionBackgroundAudio restricted capability allows apps to play audio when the app is not in the foreground.

segment.source: The extendedExecutionCritical restricted capability allows apps to begin a critical extended execution session.
segment.target: The extendedExecutionCritical restricted capability allows apps to begin a critical extended execution session.

segment.source: The extendedExecutionUnconstrained restricted capability allows apps to begin an unconstrained extended execution session.
segment.target: The extendedExecutionUnconstrained restricted capability allows apps to begin an unconstrained extended execution session.

segment.source: The deviceManagementDmAccount restricted capability allows apps to provision and configure Mobile Operator Open Mobile Alliance - Device Management (MO OMA-DM) accounts.
segment.target: The deviceManagementDmAccount restricted capability allows apps to provision and configure Mobile Operator Open Mobile Alliance - Device Management (MO OMA-DM) accounts.

segment.source: The deviceManagementFoundation restricted capability allows apps to have basic access to the Mobile Device Management (MDM) configuration service provider (CSP) infrastructure on the device. Note that other capabilities are needed to access specific CSPs.
segment.target: The deviceManagementFoundation restricted capability allows apps to have basic access to the Mobile Device Management (MDM) configuration service provider (CSP) infrastructure on the device. Note that other capabilities are needed to access specific CSPs.

segment.source: The deviceManagementWapSecurityPolicies restricted capability allows apps to configure Wireless Application Protocol (WAP)-based services such as MMs, Service Indication/Service Loading (SI/SL), and Open Mobile Alliance - Client Provisioning (OMA-CP).
segment.target: The deviceManagementWapSecurityPolicies restricted capability allows apps to configure Wireless Application Protocol (WAP)-based services such as MMs, Service Indication/Service Loading (SI/SL), and Open Mobile Alliance - Client Provisioning (OMA-CP).

segment.source: The deviceManagementEmailAccount restricted capability allows apps created by Mobile Operators to add and manage an email account on devices they provision to users.
segment.target: The deviceManagementEmailAccount restricted capability allows apps created by Mobile Operators to add and manage an email account on devices they provision to users.

segment.source: The packagePolicySystem restricted capability allows apps to have control of system policies related to apps that are installed on the device.
segment.target: The packagePolicySystem restricted capability allows apps to have control of system policies related to apps that are installed on the device.

segment.source: The gameList restricted capability allows apps to get a list of known games installed on the system.
segment.target: The gameList restricted capability allows apps to get a list of known games installed on the system.

segment.source: The xboxAccessoryManagement restricted capability allows apps to directly manage Xbox devices that conform to the Xbox hardware specification.
segment.target: The xboxAccessoryManagement restricted capability allows apps to directly manage Xbox devices that conform to the Xbox hardware specification.

segment.source: The cortanaSpeechAccessory restricted capability allows apps to invoke and pass commands to Cortana.
segment.target: The cortanaSpeechAccessory restricted capability allows apps to invoke and pass commands to Cortana.

segment.source: The accessoryManager restricted capability allows apps to register as an accessory app and opt-in to specific app notifications so that they may be forwarded to accessories and display to the user.
segment.target: The accessoryManager restricted capability allows apps to register as an accessory app and opt-in to specific app notifications so that they may be forwarded to accessories and display to the user.

segment.source: The interopServices restricted capability allows apps to interact directly with drivers.
segment.target: The interopServices restricted capability allows apps to interact directly with drivers.

segment.source: The inputForegroundObservation restricted capability allows apps in the foreground to intercept keyboard input and byasses all non-app keyboard input processing. SAS combinations cannot be intercepted by this capability. This capability is required to access members of the **KeyboardDeliveryInterceptor** class.
segment.target: The inputForegroundObservation restricted capability allows apps in the foreground to intercept keyboard input and byasses all non-app keyboard input processing. SAS combinations cannot be intercepted by this capability. This capability is required to access members of the **KeyboardDeliveryInterceptor** class.

segment.source: The oemDeployment restricted capability allows apps that are created by Microsoft partners to install new apps and query currently installed apps on the device.
segment.target: The oemDeployment restricted capability allows apps that are created by Microsoft partners to install new apps and query currently installed apps on the device.

segment.source: The oemPublicDirectory restricted capability allows apps that are created by Microsoft partners to have access to the shared app folder.
segment.target: The oemPublicDirectory restricted capability allows apps that are created by Microsoft partners to have access to the shared app folder.

segment.source: This article is for Windows 10 developers writing UWP apps.
segment.target: This article is for Windows 10 developers writing UWP apps.

segment.source: If you’re developing for Windows 8.x or Windows Phone 8.x, see the archived documentation.
segment.target: If you’re developing for Windows 8.x or Windows Phone 8.x, see the archived documentation.

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics

pc.pc: How to specify capabilities in a package manifest
How to specify capabilities in a package manifest
How to specify device capabilities in a package manifest
How to specify device capabilities in a package manifest
